DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Boost Extramedullary Anatomic Site Administered Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indication of whether or not a radiation boost was administered to an extramedullary site.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Boost Extramedullary Anatomic Site Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One or more extra radiation treatments targeted at the tumor bed, given after the regular sessions of radiation are complete._Outside of, or unrelated to, any medulla, especially the medulla oblongata._Named locations of or within the body._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One or more extra radiation treatments targeted at the tumor bed, given after the regular sessions of radiation are complete.

Concepts.definition: One or more extra radiation treatments targeted at the tumor bed, given after the regular sessions of radiation are complete.

Named locations of or within the body.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.
